metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6318 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the FascistGecosUser function in lib/fascist.c in cracklib allows local users to cause a denial of service (application crash) or gain privileges via a long GECOS field, involving longbuffer.

notes.Note: tyhicks> Ubuntu's chfn limits the total GECOS field length to 84 characters which is well within cracklib2's buffer size of 2048. libpam-cracklib is not part of the default install so PAM cracklib support is not enabled in the majority of Ubuntu installs Ubuntu's /etc/login.defs only allows unprivileged users to set their room number, work phone, and home phone

criterions.comment: cracklib2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
